params.code:
import bpy

# Key light (main)
key_light = bpy.data.lights.new(name='Key_Light', type='POINT')
key_light.energy = 1000
key_obj = bpy.data.objects.new(name='Key_Light', object_data=key_light)
key_obj.location = (5, -5, 5)
bpy.context.scene.collection.objects.link(key_obj)

# Fill light
fill_light = bpy.data.lights.new(name='Fill_Light', type='POINT')
fill_light.energy = 300
fill_obj = bpy.data.objects.new(name='Fill_Light', object_data=fill_light)
fill_obj.location = (-3, -3, 3)
bpy.context.scene.collection.objects.link(fill_obj)

# Rim light
rim_light = bpy.data.lights.new(name='Rim_Light', type='POINT')
rim_light.energy = 500
rim_obj = bpy.data.objects.new(name='Rim_Light', object_data=rim_light)
rim_obj.location = (0, 5, 4)
bpy.context.scene.collection.objects.link(rim_obj)

# Set world background to dark
bpy.context.scene.world.node_tree.nodes['Background'].inputs[0].default_value = (0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 1)

print('Three-point studio lighting setup complete')
